text:
Hey all, how can i select a class from the <body> ? i need to do some logic based on the body class.
any ideas?

• HubSpot has `{{ builtin_body_class }}`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#website-pages-variables|docs> . so try to figure out what class works for you 
• otherwise <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables-macros-syntax#macros|build a Macros> and give unique class to body based on your template if you want

Hey all, has anyone experienced issues with slick slider when added to the blog post section?
The issue i have is, when the slider is on the blog post, every time the slide turns, the screen gets focused on that slider. also when i try to edit the post with the editor, every time the the slide turns, i get focused to that particular module. any ideas on how to prevent the slider to turn when i am editing the post? i am stuck on this for a week and cant find any solution. any help is welcomed!
Thanks
Thank you both for the guidance!
What are the options are you using for slider ??.... It never happen to me...

This post from 2019 explained how to get the Blog ID if you are running a site using multiple blogs.

As far as I can tell, it was the only way to find the Blog ID, which is needed for code like this:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#blog-all-posts-url>

```{{ blog_all_posts_url('default') }}

{{ blog_all_posts_url('123456') }}```
But, as per the comment from someone 3 hours ago (funny we are both hunting for the same thing lol), it looks like the URL scheme has changed and it's no longer possible to find the Blog ID via the URL...

So how or where do I find Blog IDs?

Hey Kris, try navigating to this area: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/settings/website/blogs/>

You should see the blogs dropdown on the top and changing there should do it.
Got it, that worked, thanks! Hopefully future searchers will stumble across this. Appreciate it.
I’m going to update that forum post now for it. thank for pointing that out, much appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:
buhbye antiquated content hello fresh new aj laporte content :slightly_smiling_face:

Additionally if your creating a module, you can also <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields#blog|use the module blog field> to get the blog id. This has the added benefit that the user can change the blog that your module pulls from.
Can we get data from hubDB using primary and foreign key concept? please help me.
Have you <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/hubdb/join-multiple-tables|seen this> ?? hope it help
